However, note that the scenario and conversation text are not visible in this part. So, this section largely relies on the test-taker’s short-term memory.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_39: Here’s an additional tip: while doing Part 1 of the ‘interactive listening’ question, we have 4 minutes to complete it. Often, we don’t use all 4 minutes. So, if you’ve finished all the multiple-choice questions in the remaining time of Part 1, you can spend some time memorizing the main content of the scenario and listening text. This will help you write more content when you get to the Summarize the Conversation part.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.h2_8: Writing Templates for Different Question Types
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_40: Now, let’s look at the writing template for the ‘Problem/Solution Discussion Type,’ which is the type of conversation we just heard. You can pause this video and take a screenshot to save this template. Notice that we’ve used different colors to mark sentences in the template: blue for relatively fixed content, red for content that can be chosen based on the context, and black for content that needs to be replaced.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_42: Similarly, we’ve provided a version with upgraded vocabulary:
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_44: For students with a better foundation or aiming for higher scores, you can screenshot and save this advanced template for future practice reference.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_45: Regarding the use of template sentences, let’s add a few more tips: When using templates for your responses, it’s important to keep a few key points in mind. First and foremost, always make sure your content stays relevant to the topic at hand. Don’t try to force the template to fit if it doesn’t quite work – that can lead to awkward or inappropriate usage.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_46: As you work through multiple questions, be careful not to repeat the same points over and over. This can make your responses feel repetitive and less engaging. It’s also crucial to double-check your spelling, grammar, and syntax in the template sentences. Small errors can really stand out and detract from your message.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_47: Remember, the opening and closing sentences in these templates are often optional. If they don’t feel necessary for a particular response, it’s perfectly fine to omit them. This can help your answer feel more natural and tailored to the specific question.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_48: Lastly, while templates can be helpful guides, try not to rely on them too heavily. The goal is to develop your own skills in formulating responses. Use the templates as a starting point, but practice putting things in your own words and developing your unique voice. This will make your answers more authentic and demonstrate your true understanding of the material.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_49: Alright, now let’s use these template sentences to complete the summary writing part based on the previous conversation content. You can pause here to practice using the template for writing.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_50: Welcome back. Let’s look at the sample answer. You can take a screenshot to save this answer.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_51: The conversation is about taking a gap year before university. I am a student who has a question about whether I should take a year off before starting college. I talked to another student who is my friend and asked for their advice. They suggested that I should consider various options like traveling, volunteering, working, or simply taking some time off. They also advised that I should discuss this idea with my parents, who have already offered to pay for my university education. I think their idea is feasible, and I decided to follow it.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_52: Similarly, we’ve also completed a summary of this conversation using the advanced template sentences. You can screenshot and save this answer for future reference and study.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_53: The conversation revolves around the concept of taking a gap year before university. I am a student who has a concern regarding whether I should defer my college education for a year. I sought another student who is my friend and solicited their advice. They proposed that I ought to consider various options such as traveling, volunteering, working, or simply taking time off. They also suggested that I should discuss this idea with my parents, who have already offered to finance my university education. I evaluated their idea as feasible, and I opted to follow it.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_54: Now, let’s look at a sample question of the Classroom Content/Academic Question Type. Before that, please practice this sample question first by using this link: https://englishtest.duolingo.com/sample-question?type=aic&scenario=student-professor
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_55: First, let’s examine the scenario part.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_56: There are some key pieces of information here. Firstly, it introduces the characters and their identities in the dialogue, namely a student and a professor. Your problem is that you don’t fully understand the term, ‘cultivate sources’, so you want to ask the professor for further explanation.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_57: Alright, after analyzing the scenario, let’s look at Part 1. Notice that in this question, we don’t start with the audio part, but with making a choice. This is the same in the actual exam; the order is not fixed. You might first hear an audio clip, or you might need to make a choice first.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_58: Let’s look at the first question. When choosing, we can refer to the scenario and compare. Through comparison, we find that option 4 matches the description in the scenario, so it’s correct.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_59: The professor then responds, “Sure. What was it?” asking about your specific question. This isn’t very complicated. We can continue to compare with the scenario and find that the last option is the most fitting, matching the question description in the scenario. So we choose it as the correct answer.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_60: The professor then says: “Absolutely. Cultivating sources refers to the process of developing relationships with people who can provide information for stories. This can be done in a number of ways, but some common ones are attending events that potential sources are likely to be attending, initiating conversations, or asking current sources for additional people they may know.” This answer is long, but essentially, the professor is explaining what ‘Cultivating sources’ means and how to do it.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_61: How would you respond? Let’s look at the options. The options in this question are relatively simple, but we can’t refer to the scenario anymore. We need to analyze each option. First, ‘earn extra credit’ wasn’t mentioned in the conversation, so we can rule it out. The second option, asking about a story, wasn’t mentioned either. Similarly, ‘I guess’ and the last option about scheduling a meeting time don’t match the conversation. So, we choose option 3, asking about the comparison with networking, as the correct option.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_62: Next, the professor says: ‘In a way, yes. But unlike traditional networking where the goal is to meet as many people as possible, the goal with cultivating sources is to develop deeper relationships with key people who can provide you with information that you need about a topic.’ This explains the similarities and differences between cultivating sources and networking.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_63: Then, we need to continue analyzing the options. The first option, ‘solar energy,’ wasn’t mentioned. The third option, ‘interested in both fields,’ also wasn’t mentioned. The last two options, ‘two modes of transportation’ and ‘study group,’ are also unmentioned content, so they can be eliminated. Therefore, the second option is the correct one. Here, you asked the professor about the importance of these relationships.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_64: So, the professor should explain why it’s important. The professor continues: ‘It makes your job as a reporter more efficient. Instead of having to call strangers for information or contact public relations departments, you can reach out to your sources and get the information that you need quickly and easily.’
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_65: At this point, the professor should have answered all your questions, and we should express gratitude. So for the last question, we can choose the fourth option as the correct answer.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_67: Before we do Part 2, let’s learn two writing templates for the Classroom Content/Academic Question Type. You can pause the video and screenshot these templates to save them.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_69: The conversation is about + the topic of conversation. I am a student who was [confused/curious] about + a knowledge point or concept that the professor explained in the lecture. I approached my professor and asked + my question to them. They answered my question and clarified + a knowledge point or concept with + example/analogy/definition/explanation. I thanked them for the explanation and said that I understood it better. The conversation helped me to learn more about + the topic of conversation.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_70: Note that the parts in black font in the templates can be changed according to the specific content of the listening.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_71: • Interactive Listening Template Sentences (Vocabulary Enhanced Version)
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_73: The conversation pertains to + the topic of conversation. I am a student who is [perplexed/intrigued] by + a knowledge point or concept that the professor elucidated in the lecture. I approached the professor after the lecture and inquired + my question to them. They responded to my question and expounded on + a knowledge point or concept with + example/analogy/definition/explanation. I expressed my gratitude for the clarification and affirmed that I comprehended it more clearly than before. The conversation enhances my learning of + the topic of conversation.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_74: For the vocabulary-upgraded version of the template, we can use it as appropriate.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_75: Alright, now we can practice using these templates to summarize the content of the above dialogue.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_76: Welcome back, let’s look at the sample answer. You can screenshot to save this answer.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_77: The conversation is about journalistic practices. I am a student who was curious about the concept of cultivating sources as a reporter which the professor explained in the lecture. I approached my professor and asked them to clarify this concept for me. They answered my question and clarified the process of cultivating sources with a definition and example. They explained that it involves building relationships with people who can provide information for stories. They gave an example of attending events where potential sources are likely to be present and initiating conversations with them. They also clarified the usefulness of having sources. I thanked them for the explanation and said that I understood it better.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_78: That concludes today’s lesson on the ‘interactive listening’ question type. See you next time. Bye!
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_79: Similarly, we’ve also completed a summary of this dialogue using the advanced template sentences.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_80: The conversation pertains to journalistic practices in reporting. I am a student who is intrigued by the concept of cultivating sources that the professor elucidated in the lecture. I approached the professor after the lecture and inquired about the process of developing and maintaining sources as a reporter. They responded to my question and expounded on the concept of source cultivation with definitions and practical examples. They explained that it involves building relationships with individuals who can provide valuable information for news stories. They further clarified the concept by explaining how having a network of sources allows reporters to gather information efficiently. I expressed my gratitude for the clarification and affirmed that I comprehended it more clearly than before.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_81: You can screenshot and save this answer for future study.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_82: This comprehensive guide to the DET Interactive Listening section provides test-takers with valuable insights and strategies. Key takeaways include:

ol_2.li_1: Understanding the structure of the Interactive Listening section, including the Listen and Respond and Summarize the Conversation parts.
ol_2.li_2: Recognizing different types of conversations and scenarios in the test.
ol_2.li_3: Developing effective strategies for answering multiple-choice questions and writing summaries.
ol_2.li_4: Utilizing provided templates to improve response quality and consistency.
ol_2.li_5: Practicing with sample questions and answers to familiarize oneself with the test format.

det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_83: By following these guidelines and regularly practicing, test-takers can significantly improve their performance in the Interactive Listening section of the DET. Remember to adapt strategies to your personal strengths and continue refining your skills through consistent practice.
det_prep_course_interactive_listening.p_84: This concludes the content of our lesson today. See you in our next post!

seometa.title: DET Prep Course: Speak about the Photo - DET Practice
seometa.description: Learn how to for describe the "Speak about the Photo" questions in the Duolingo English Test with our comprehensive guide.

det_course_speak_about_the_photo.img1: A cover for DET course: Speak about the Photo
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.h11: DET Prep Course: Speak about the Photo
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p2: This comprehensive guide explains the “Speak about the Photo” question type in the Duolingo English Test. It covers three main categories: people, scenery and objects, and animals. For each category, the article provides detailed answering steps, templates, and examples to help test-takers improve their responses.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p3: A video version of this course:

ul.li1: 1. Introduction to Speak about the Photo

det_course_speak_about_the_photo.h22: Introduction to Speak about the Photo
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p5: Hello everyone, welcome to the Duolingo English Test Prep Hub. Today, we’re going to explain a question type called Speak about the Photo. Before we start explaining the specific content, please note that the images used in this course are either AI-generated or copyright-free stock photos. Alright, let’s begin introducing the question format.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.img2: A screenshot of Speak about the Photo UI, from Duolingo English Test.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p6: First, let’s take a look at the question format. Speak about the Photo has a very simple format – we just need to verbally describe the image we see when answering the question. This type of question will appear once in each test. Note that this is a speaking question, so when answering, we should try to ensure a natural speaking pace and clear pronunciation. Before answering this question, we have 20 seconds to observe the image, please use this time wisely. In addition, we only have one chance to answer. After we start recording, there is no way to pause or cancel and re-record. Lastly, please pay more attention to fluency when answering, as this is a very important scoring criterion for speaking tests.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.img3: Demo questions of Duolingo English Test: Speak about the Photo.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.figcaption2: Speak about the Photo Demo Questions
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p7: Next, let’s look at the categories of Speak about the Photo questions. Here are some sample images. Everyone can observe these images and try to guess the categories.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.img4: A diagram shows categories of DET speak about the photo questions.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.figcaption3: Categories of DET Speak about the Photo Questions
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p8: Alright, let’s look at the specific categories of Speak about the Photo questions. Speak about the Photo questions can be roughly divided into 3 types: people, scenery and objects, and animals. In the following post, we will introduce and explain each one.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p9: First, let’s look at the people category of Speak about the Photo questions.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p10: Check the steps for answering people category questions:
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p11: 1. We can start with the overall scene: Begin by describing the background or setting of the image. Mention whether it’s an indoor or outdoor scene, the time of day, and any relevant colors or features. For example, we can say: “The picture shows a group of people gathered in a lush, green park on a sunny afternoon.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p12: 2. Then, we can describe the people: Talk about how many people are in the picture, their ages, genders, and any notable characteristics such as clothing, hairstyles, or accessories. For example: “There are five people in the picture, including two women, two men, and a young child. The women are wearing summer dresses and wide-brimmed hats, while the men are dressed in casual shirts and pants. The child is wearing a bright red shirt and shorts.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p13: 3. In the third step, we can mention their positions and postures: Explain how the people are arranged in the frame and describe their body language and what actions they’re performing. For example, we can say: “The two women are sitting on a picnic blanket, chatting and laughing, while one of the men is standing nearby with a camera, taking a photo. The other man is playfully chasing the child, who is running with a big smile on their face.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p14: 4. In the fourth step, we can discuss facial expressions and emotions: Describe the expressions on people’s faces and the emotions they seem to be feeling. For example: “Everyone in the picture looks happy and relaxed. The women have warm smiles on their faces as they talk, and the man with the camera has a look of concentration mixed with amusement. The child’s face is full of joy and excitement.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p15: 5. Then in the fifth step, we can discuss any other details: Mention any other elements in the image, such as objects, animals, or other people in the background, which can add to the overall atmosphere or story. Like: “In the background, we can see other park-goers enjoying the day, including a couple walking their dog and a group of friends playing frisbee.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p16: 6. In the sixth step, we can summarize the overall impression: Finally, sum up the general mood or theme conveyed by the image. Such as: “This picture captures a joyful and carefree summer day spent with friends and family in a beautiful park setting.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p17: 7. In the last step, we can use our imagination and personal experiences: Connect similar scenes or events that have happened to you to expand your answer and extend your speaking time. This method can be used to provide a more comprehensive response. For example: “The picture reminds me of a family picnic we had last summer at a nearby park. Just like in the photo, we spent the day laughing, playing games, and enjoying each other’s company. The atmosphere was so warm and joyful, and it’s a memory I’ll always cherish.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p18: This way, we can completely describe a people category image.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p19: After understanding the steps to answer people category questions in Speak about the Photo, let’s look at some common ways to expand on topics:
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.img5: A diagram shows common ways to expand on DET people-related questions.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.figcaption4: Common Ways to Expand People-Related Photo
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p20: When answering Speak about the Photo questions, we can expand from the following directions, such as: Number of People, Gender, Age, Clothing, Background and Environment, Actions and Behaviors, Positioning and Posture, Other Elements, Atmosphere and Theme, Imagination and Experience, Facial Expressions and Emotions. Expanding our answers from these directions will make it relatively easier to develop a Speak about the Photo answer.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p21: Let’s look at the question below:
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.img6: A screenshot of DET Speak about the Photo: sample question 1.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.figcaption5: Speak about the Photo: Sample Question 1
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p22: One difficulty with image questions is that they are not easy to organize answers for, because we don’t have any prompts to help us answer. But actually, during practice, we can ask ourselves questions around the image, like the following ones:

ul5.li1: How many people are in the image?
ul5.li2: What are the occupations or roles of the people?
ul5.li3: What is the body type of the people?
ul5.li4: What clothing or accessories are they wearing?
ul5.li5: What are they doing and in what manner?
ul5.li6: Where are they? What are the characteristics of this place?
ul5.li7: What’s the time, weather, and air quality like in the image?
ul5.li8: Is there any additional information that can be inferred? (Image background/personal experiences, etc.)

det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p23: If we answer these questions in order, we can organize a complete answer. Next, let’s try to answer this question:
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p24: Well, from this picture, I can see that there is a kid who has curly blonde hair. In this step, we describe the number and appearance of people in the image. Then we can say, she is prostrating on the grass and blowing a dry dandelion flower with rapt attention, to describe the actions and behaviors of the person in the image. We can see that she is wearing a white sleeveless top, so we can predict that the weather is mild. In this step, we mention the person’s clothing and the weather. I guess this adorable kid could be a kindergarten student, and she doesn’t have much coursework to do every day. So, she could have enough spare time playing outside. Here we make reasonable guesses and associations about the background of the photo.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p25: That reminds me of my childhood. When I was a kid, I liked to play in a park in my neighborhood. There are beautiful gardens, and an open grassland just like the one in this picture. My friends and I have taken numerous photos in the park, and it was fun to play out in nature. In this step, we can relate to some of our own life experiences. Here we must note that when doing Speak about the Photo questions, we cannot start with associations and imagination right away. We must first objectively describe the image to ensure the relevance of the answer.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p26: At the end of the answer, if we still have time, we can comment on the image itself. For example, we can say Personally, I think playing out in nature has numbers of benefits. For instance, outdoor play encourages children to run, jump, skip, climb, and be active, helping people to stay fit and healthy. Besides, nature provides an environment that encourages exploration and discovery, which can reduce stress and improve mood. And I believe the kid in this picture will benefit a lot from playing out in nature. At this point, we have completely answered the sample question.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p27: Let’s summarize and recap the answering steps for people category questions in Speak about the Photo. In the first step, describe the people in the image, such as the number of people, gender, age, appearance, posture, actions, facial expressions, occupation, identity, etc. Next, we can describe the background in the image, such as the environment, background objects, weather, other people and things in the background, etc. Finally, we can expand on associations, such as background stories related to the image, personal experiences, etc. In this way, we complete the answer to this question.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.img7: A diagram shows the summary of steps for answering DET "Speak about the Photo" questions.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p28: Next, let’s learn an answer template for Speak about the Photo. This is an answer template suitable for images with only one person. It helps us organize our answers. Pay attention to the font color of the template. The blue font is the template sentence, and the red font is the part we can replace in the answer. You can take a screenshot to save these template sentences.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p29: Well, from this photo, I can see there is a person pictured. I see a [man/woman/boy/girl]. He/she looks to be about [age] years old, with [hair color and length] and [other distinctive features]. The person seems to be [description of facial expression, gestures, actions]. This makes me think he/she is feeling [emotion] because [logical reasoning].
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p30: Based on his/her [clothing, accessories, surroundings] after describing appearance and behavior, I would guess he/she is a [occupation or role/status].
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p31: In the background, I can see [environmental details]. This setting makes me imagine [reasonable speculation about the situation]. Overall, this picture reminds me of [personal history]. The [emotion] I sense reminds me of when I [related event]. Or this photo looks like it could portray [imagined story]. I imagine this captures a [interesting, poignant, etc.] moment where he/she is [possible description of actions]. The scene looks like [imagined story description].
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p32: After familiarizing yourself with these template sentences, let’s try to use them to answer. We continue to use the previous sample image. Note that our sample answer also has two font colors. The blue font is the template sentence we just talked about, and the black font is the content we fill in when answering:
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p33: Well, from this photo, I can see there’s a person pictured, specifically a little girl. She looks to be about kindergarten age, with curly blonde hair and an air of innocence. The girl seems to be engrossed in blowing a dry dandelion flower while prostrating on the grass. This makes me think she’s feeling joyful and carefree, perhaps because of the simplicity of the moment and the freedom that comes with childhood. Based on her white sleeveless top and the outdoor setting, I would guess she’s enjoying a mild weather day and maybe a kindergarten student with lots of spare time to play outside. In the background, I can see a wide expanse of grass, reminiscent of a park or a large garden. This setting makes me imagine a day filled with laughter, exploration, and fun childhood games. Overall, this picture reminds me of my childhood days. The sense of freedom and joy I perceive reminds me of the times when I used to play in a park in my neighborhood, similar to the one in this picture. We had beautiful gardens and open grasslands, and my friends and I took numerous photos there, just as this girl is doing. Or this photo could portray a simple yet profound story of the joys of childhood. I imagine this captures a happy, carefree moment where she’s fully engaged in her play, oblivious to the world around her. The scene looks like a beautiful tableau of a day in the life of a child, underscoring the importance and benefits of outdoor play, from physical activity to stress reduction and mood improvement.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p34: Alright, we know that in the Duolingo English Test, vocabulary complexity is also one of the more important scoring criteria. The more complex and advanced vocabulary we use in our answers, the more we can relatively improve our scores. So next, let’s learn an advanced answer template suitable for single-person images to improve the wording in the previous template. Same as before, we split the template font into two colors. The blue font is the template sentence, and the red font is the part we can replace in the answer.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.h32: Advanced template for answering questions (single person):
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p35: Well, from this photo, I can discern there is a person depicted. I identify a [man/woman/boy/girl]. He/she appears to be about [age] years old, with [hair color and length] and [other distinctive features]. The person exhibits [description of facial expression, gestures, actions]. This leads me to infer he/she is experiencing [emotion] because [logical reasoning]. Taking into account his/her [clothing, accessories, surroundings] after describing appearance and behavior, I would hypothesize he/she is a [occupation or role/status]. In the background, I can perceive [environmental details]. This setting spurs my imagination to envision [reasonable speculation about the situation]. Overall, this picture evokes memories of [personal history]. The [emotion] I sense harks back to the time when I [related event]. Or this photo looks like it could encapsulate a narrative of [imagined story]. I imagine this captures a [interesting, poignant, etc.] moment where he/she is [possible description of actions]. The scene looks like a vivid depiction of [imagined story description].
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p36: You can take a screenshot to save these template sentences. Let’s try to use this advanced template to answer the previous question:

In the background, I can see [description of environment, weather, objects, etc.]. This setting makes me imagine [reasonable speculation about the situation].

det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p48: Next, let’s explain the scenery and objects category questions in Speak about the Photo. First, let’s look at the answering steps for scenery and objects questions.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p49: 1. We can start with the overall impression, outlining the scene, time, weather, and emotional atmosphere. For example: “This photo depicts a tranquil lakeside scene on a clear morning that evokes a feeling of peace and stillness.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p50: 2. In the second step, we can describe the elements in the foreground and background. For example: “In the foreground, a lone rowboat floats on the glassy water while in the distance, rolling green hills stretch under a bright blue sky.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p51: 3. In the third step, describe the details of the image, such as colors, lighting, and composition. We can say something like this: “The golden sunlight spills over the hills, illuminating the vivid green grass. The rowboat cuts a diagonal line across the frame, dividing the image into equal halves.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p52: 4. In the fourth step, we can describe the actions or emotions in the scene. For example: “The stillness of the boat suggests a pause in time and movement, inviting the viewer to linger in this tranquil space.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p53: 5. In the fifth step, we can express personal feelings or inspire imagination. For example: “Looking at this scene fills me with a sense of peace and renewal. It makes me want to spend a quiet morning taking in the beauty of nature. This could be a retreat to escape the noise of everyday life.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p54: 6. In the final sixth step, we can summarize the key points of the scene or convey the theme. For example: “Overall, the soft colors and stillness of this photo encourage reflection and appreciation for the simple beauty of the natural world. It captures a moment of profound tranquility.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p55: Alright, these are the steps for answering scenery and objects category questions in Speak about the Photo. Next, let’s learn a template for answering scenery and objects category questions. Same as before, we split the template font into two colors. The blue font is the template sentence, and the red font is the part we can replace in the answer.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p56: This photo depicts [describe scene, time, weather and overall atmosphere]. In the foreground, [describe elements in the foreground of the photo] while in the distance, [describe elements in the background or distance of the photo]. The colors of the picture are [describe the effect of the colors]. The [describe light source] reflects on [describe surface], creating a [describe effect]. The [describe one element] forms a [describe shape or line] that contrasts with [describe another contrasting element]. The scene shows a [describe atmosphere], with no signs of [describe something absent or present in the scene]. The viewer can imagine [describe sounds or sensations]. Looking at this scene makes me feel [express personal emotion]. It makes me want to [express personal desire or plan]. This could be a [express personal interpretation or imagination]. Overall, the [summarize main features or effects of the photo] convey a sense of [summarize main atmosphere or theme of the photo]. It captures a moment of [summarize main impression or message of the photo].
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p57: You can take the screenshot to save these template sentences. OK, next, let’s try to use the template sentences we just learned to answer the question below.

det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p58: First, let’s observe this question image. This is a typical scenery and objects question. Let’s try to answer this question:
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p59: This photo depicts a picturesque rural landscape on a bright, sunny day with clear blue skies, likely in late summer or early autumn. In the foreground, a majestic oak tree with spreading branches frames the scene, its leaves glowing golden in the sunlight, while in the distance, rolling green fields stretch out towards tree-lined hills on the horizon. The colors of the picture are vibrant and warm, with rich greens, golden yellows, and a deep blue sky. The sunlight reflects on the leaves and grass, creating a dazzling effect of light and shadow. The oak tree forms a natural arch that contrasts with the open expanse of the meadow beyond. The scene shows a tranquil countryside atmosphere, with no signs of urban development or modern intrusions. The viewer can imagine the gentle rustling of leaves in a light breeze and the chirping of birds in the branches. Looking at this scene makes me feel peaceful and connected to nature. It makes me want to take a leisurely walk through the fields and breathe in the fresh country air. This could be a perfect spot for a picnic or a quiet afternoon of contemplation. Overall, the interplay of light, vibrant colors, and natural elements convey a sense of timeless beauty and serenity. It captures a moment of harmony between the cultivated landscape and the wild, untamed aspects of nature.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p60: Next is the advanced template with upgraded vocabulary:

The [describe light source] casts a glow on the [describe surface], thereby crafting a [describe effect]. Gazing upon this vista stirs up sensations of [express personal feelings]. It compels me to [express personal wishes or plans]. This could potentially be a [express personal insights or imagination]. In summary, the [overview of the main features or effects of the photo] project a profound sense of [summarize the main features or effects of the photo]. It encapsulates a singular moment of [summarize the overall impression or information of the photo].

In the immediate vicinity, a grand oak tree with golden-hued leaves and gnarled branches contrasts with the expansive green meadows and distant hills in the background. The palette of the image is rich and warm, dominated by vibrant greens, golden yellows, and a deep azure sky. One can almost hear the soft whisper of leaves rustling in a gentle breeze and birdsong echoing from the branches. Gazing upon this vista stirs up sensations of serenity and a deep connection to nature. It compels me to embark on a leisurely stroll through the meadow, basking in the pastoral beauty. This could potentially be a perfect setting for quiet contemplation or a peaceful outdoor retreat. In summary, the harmonious blend of natural elements, radiant sunlight, and vibrant colors project a profound sense of timeless beauty and rural tranquility. It encapsulates a singular moment of perfect equilibrium between managed farmland and the untamed splendor of nature.

det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p65: You may try to use the template sentences you just learned to answer. Alright, let’s see how to answer this question:
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p66: This photo depicts a vibrant street scene in what appears to be a Mediterranean or Italian coastal town on a bright, sunny day with clear blue skies. In the foreground, a striking red building with green shutters and terracotta roof tiles dominates the view, while in the distance, a row of colorful houses in shades of pink, blue, and yellow line a narrow street. The colors of the picture are bold and saturated, creating a cheerful and lively atmosphere. The bright sunlight reflects on the building surfaces, creating a warm glow that emphasizes the rich hues of the facades. The red building forms a strong vertical line that contrasts with the horizontal stretch of the street behind it. The scene shows a quaint and picturesque setting, with no signs of modern urban development or busy traffic. The viewer can imagine the quiet sounds of a sleepy town – perhaps distant conversations, shutters creaking in a gentle breeze, or seagulls calling from nearby. Looking at this scene makes me feel transported and relaxed. It makes me want to stroll down that inviting street and explore the charming town. This could be a perfect vacation spot for those seeking a peaceful retreat in a colorful, historic setting. Overall, the vivid colors and traditional architecture convey a sense of timeless beauty and cultural richness. It captures a moment of serene Mediterranean life, inviting the viewer to slow down and appreciate the simple pleasures of a sun-drenched coastal village.

det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p68: This photograph presents a tableau of a sun-drenched Mediterranean street scene, likely in a coastal Italian or Southern European town, on a bright, cloudless day. In the immediate vicinity, a vibrant red building with green shutters and terra cotta roof tiles contrasts with the colorful row of houses lining a narrow street in the distance. The palette of the image is rich and saturated, dominated by warm reds, cool blues, and cheerful pastels. The brilliant sunlight casts a glow on the building facades, thereby crafting a warm, inviting atmosphere that accentuates the vivid hues. The red building delineates a strong vertical line that starkly juxtaposes against the horizontal stretch of the winding street behind it. Gazing upon this vista stirs up sensations of tranquility and wonder. It compels me to wander down that inviting street, camera in hand, to discover hidden cafes and local artisans. This could potentially be a serene getaway destination, perfect for those seeking to escape the hustle of modern life and immerse themselves in the laid-back rhythm of a picturesque coastal village. In summary, the vivid colors, traditional architecture, and serene atmosphere project a profound sense of cultural richness and unhurried lifestyle. It encapsulates a singular moment of Mediterranean allure, inviting the viewer to pause and savor the simple beauty of everyday life in this enchanting locale.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p69: The above is our explanation of the scenery and objects category questions in Speak about the Photo.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p70: At the end of this lesson, let’s explain the animals category questions in Speak about the Photo. First, let’s look at the answering steps for animals category questions.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p71: 1. We can start with an overview, summarizing the scene and mentioning the main subjects (animals) in the image along with their surrounding environment. For example: “In this picture, there’s a cute dog playing in a beautiful garden full of colorful flowers.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p72: 2. In the second step, we can focus on details by describing the physical characteristics of the animals in the picture, such as their color, size, and breed. Like: “The dog is white and fluffy, and it looks like a poodle.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p73: 3. In the third step, we can describe the actions or expressions of the animals, noting what they’re doing or how they appear. For example: “The dog is jumping up and down, and it seems very happy and excited.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p74: 4. In the fourth step, we can provide details about the environment in the image, such as the types of flowers, their colors, and quantity. For example: “The garden is full of roses, tulips, daisies, and other flowers, and they are red, yellow, pink, and purple.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p75: 5. In the fifth step, we can describe any other elements in the picture, including the presence or absence of people, objects, or background features. For example: “There is also a wooden bench in the garden and a blue sky with some white clouds in the background.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p76: 6. In the sixth step, we can summarize the main theme or feeling of the image, considering what the picture might be trying to convey or what impression it gives. For example: “This picture shows a lovely scene of a dog enjoying nature, and it makes me feel relaxed and cheerful.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p77: 7. In the final seventh step, we can share a personal observation or feeling related to the image to express your own attitude or emotional response. For example: “I think dogs are very loyal and friendly animals, and I would love to have a dog like this one someday.”
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p78: These are the answering steps for animals category questions. Next, let’s learn the answer template for animals category questions. First is the answer template suitable for single animal image questions.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p79: Looking at this picture, it’s all about a [mention the animal] that’s right there in a [briefly describe the surrounding environment]. Going into details, this [animal] is [describe the animal’s characteristics, such as color, size, breed, etc.]. What’s really interesting is what the [animal] is doing or how it looks: [explain in detail what the animal is doing or how it appears]. Now about the place where it is, [describe the specific details of the environment]. Besides this, you can see [mention other elements in the photo]. The whole vibe of this picture is [summarize the theme or feeling of the photo]. To wrap it up with my personal thought, [share a personal perspective or feeling related to the photo].
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p80: You may take a screenshot to save these template sentences. Next, let’s look at the image below with a cute dog.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.img11: A screenshot of DET Speak about the Photo: Sample Question 5.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.figcaption10: Speak about the Photo: Sample Question 5
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p81: You can try to answer this question according to the template sentences. Alright, let’s answer this question:
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p82: Looking at this picture, it’s all about a dog that’s right there in a room filled with moving boxes. Going into details, this dog is a small to medium-sized breed, possibly a Jack Russell Terrier or similar mix, with a predominantly white coat and some brown markings on its face. What’s really interesting is what the dog is doing or how it looks: it’s sitting attentively on top of a cardboard box, appearing alert and curious with its ears perked up and mouth slightly open in what looks like a friendly expression. Now about the place where it is, the room seems to be in the midst of a move or reorganization, with several cardboard boxes of various sizes stacked around. Besides this, you can see a small potted tree or plant with green leaves in the foreground, adding a touch of life to the otherwise beige and neutral-toned scene. The whole vibe of this picture is one of transition and new beginnings, with the dog at the center of the change. To wrap it up with my personal thought, this image captures a heartwarming moment of a pet adapting to a new situation, reminding us that home is wherever our loved ones are, even in the midst of change.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p83: Next, let’s learn an advanced answer template suitable for single animal images.

Delving into the specifics, the [animal] has [describe the animal’s characteristics, such as color, size, breed, etc.]. What piques my interest is how the [animal] is behaving or its apparent mood: [explain in detail what the animal is doing or how it appears]. Regarding the setting it’s in, [describe the specific details of the environment]. Additionally, [mention other elements in the photo]. The overarching impression of this image is [summarize the theme or feeling of the photo]. To conclude with a personal perspective, [share a personal viewpoint or emotion related to the photo].
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p85: Similarly, you can take a screenshot to save these template sentences. Let’s try to use this advanced template to describe the previous image:
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p86: Looking at this picture, it portrays a dog situated in a room filled with moving boxes. Delving into the specifics, the dog has a predominantly white coat with brown markings on its face, and appears to be a small to medium-sized breed, possibly a Jack Russell Terrier or similar mix. What piques my interest is how the dog is behaving or its apparent mood: it’s perched attentively on top of a cardboard box, with an alert posture, ears perked up, and mouth slightly open in what seems to be a friendly, curious expression. Regarding the setting it’s in, the room is clearly in a state of transition, with multiple cardboard boxes of various sizes stacked around, suggesting a move or major reorganization is underway. Additionally, there’s a small potted tree or plant with vibrant green leaves visible in the foreground, providing a refreshing contrast to the neutral tones of the boxes and flooring. The overarching impression of this image is one of change and adaptation, with the dog at the center of a shifting environment. To conclude with a personal perspective, this photo beautifully captures the resilience of pets during times of transition. It reminds me that animals, much like humans, can find comfort and even excitement in new situations, making any place feel like home as long as they’re with their loved ones.

Now about the place where they are, [describe the specific details of the environment]. Besides them, you can see [mention other elements in the photo]. The whole vibe of this picture is [summarize the theme or feeling of the photo]. To wrap it up with my personal thought, [share a personal perspective or feeling related to the photo].

det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p91: Okay, now let’s use the template sentences we just learned to answer:
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p92: Looking at this picture, it’s all about the dog and cat that are right there in a sunny outdoor setting. Going into details, these animals are a golden-haired puppy, likely a small breed or mixed breed, and a young tabby kitten. What’s really interesting is what the animals are doing or how they look: they’re facing each other with curiosity, the puppy sitting upright with its fur backlit by the sun, creating a golden halo effect, while the kitten is in a more crouched position, looking up at the dog. Now about the place where they are, it appears to be a grassy area with dappled sunlight filtering through trees or foliage above. Besides them, you can see a small toy ball between them on the ground. The whole vibe of this picture is one of innocent friendship and curiosity between two different species. To wrap it up with my personal thought, this image captures a heartwarming moment that reminds us of the simple joys in life and the potential for unexpected connections.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p93: Similarly, let’s learn the advanced template suitable for answering multi-animal image questions.

Moving on to the details, the [animals] have [describe animal characteristics, such as colors, etc.], [sizes], and [breeds]. What piques my interest is how the [animals] are behaving or their apparent mood: [explain in detail what the animals are doing or how they appear]. Regarding the setting they are in, [describe the specific details of the environment]. Furthermore, [mention other elements in the photo]. The overarching impression of this image is [summarize the theme or feeling of the photo]. To conclude with a personal perspective, [share a personal viewpoint or emotion related to the photo].
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p95: You can take a screenshot to save it. Then, let’s try to use the advanced template to answer the previous question:
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p96: Looking at this picture, it portrays some dog and cat situated in a sunlit outdoor area. Moving on to the details, the animals have golden fur for the dog and tabby striped fur for the cat, both appear to be small in size, and seem to be a young puppy (possibly a mixed breed) and a kitten respectively. What piques my interest is how the animals are behaving or their apparent mood: they’re facing each other with evident curiosity, the puppy sitting upright with its fur beautifully backlit by the sun, creating a glowing effect, while the kitten is in a more alert, slightly crouched position, gazing up at the dog. Regarding the setting they are in, it’s a grassy patch with dappled sunlight filtering through what appears to be overhead foliage, creating a warm, natural ambiance. Furthermore, there’s a small toy ball placed between the two animals on the ground. The overarching impression of this image is one of innocent companionship and inter-species curiosity in a serene natural setting. To conclude with a personal perspective, this charming scene reminds me of the pure, uncomplicated nature of animal interactions and the potential for unexpected friendships, evoking a sense of warmth and optimism.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p97: Alright, that’s our explanation of the animals category questions in Speak about the Photo.
det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p98: The “Speak about the Photo” question is a crucial component of the Duolingo English Test. This comprehensive guide has provided a detailed breakdown of how to approach this question type across three main categories: people, scenery and objects, and animals. Key takeaways include:

ui100.li1: Understanding the question format and time constraints
ui100.li2: Learning specific answering steps for each category
ui100.li3: Utilizing provided templates to structure responses
ui100.li4: Practicing with example questions and answers
ui100.li5: Focusing on key aspects such as overall impression, specific details, actions or emotions, and personal observations

det_course_speak_about_the_photo.p99: By implementing these strategies and consistently practicing, test-takers can significantly improve their ability to describe images fluently and comprehensively. Remember that mastering this question type not only boosts your performance on the Duolingo English Test but also enhances your overall English speaking skills. With dedication and the right approach, you can confidently tackle the “Speak about the Photo” question and excel in your test.

seometa.title: DET Prep Course: Read, then Speak & Listen, then Speak - DET Practice
seometa.description: Boost your Duolingo English Test score with our comprehensive guide to 'Read, Then Speak' and 'Listen, Then Speak' questions.

det-course-read-listen-then-speak.answer1: Describe your dream job. What does it involve? What qualifications or experience do you need? What would be the hardest thing about the job?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.answer2: Some people think celebrities are not good role models for teenagers. Do you agree or disagree? And why?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.answer3: Compare the eating habits of young people today to those of an older generation.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.img1: A cover of DET read listen then speak lesson.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.h11: DET Prep Course: Read, then Speak & Listen, then Speak
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p2: This comprehensive guide tackles the speaking section of the Duolingo English Test, focusing on ‘Read, Then Speak’ and ‘Listen, Then Speak’ questions. We’ll explore the test format, scoring criteria, and three main question categories: descriptive, argumentative, and comparative. You’ll learn essential strategies, including the versatile opening sentence technique and tailored templates for each question type. We also provide advanced vocabulary tips for high scorers and offer practice questions with sample answers. Whether you’re a beginner or aiming for top marks, this post will equip you with the tools to excel in your Duolingo English Test speaking tasks.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p3: Hello everyone, and welcome to our Duolingo English Test Prep Hub. Today, we’ll be covering two speaking question types: ‘Read, then speak’ and ‘Listen, then speak’.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p4: Let’s start by looking at an overview of these question types. First up is the ‘Read, then speak’ format. It’s classified as an Oral Response Question, which means you’ll be expected to provide a spoken answer. You’ll need to formulate and articulate your thoughts verbally.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p5: Now, how often will you see this type of question? It appears once per session. This means you should be prepared for it, but don’t worry about facing multiple instances of this question type.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p6: Let’s move on to some key tips for tackling this question effectively:
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p7: 1. Answer clearly and naturally: This is crucial. You want to sound confident and comfortable, not like you’re reciting memorized text. Speak as if you’re having a conversation with someone.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p8: 2. Use a variety of vocabulary and sentence structures: This is your chance to showcase your language skills. Don’t stick to simple sentences or basic words. Demonstrate the breadth of your English knowledge by incorporating diverse vocabulary and constructing complex sentences where appropriate.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p9: 3. Ensure fluency: The goal here is to speak smoothly without too many pauses or hesitations. Practice is key to improving your fluency. The more comfortable you are with speaking English, the more natural your response will sound.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p10: 4. Pay attention to pronunciation and intonation: It’s not just about what you say, but how you say it. Clear pronunciation helps ensure you’re understood, while proper intonation can convey meaning and emotion, making your speech more engaging and natural-sounding.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p11: Next, let’s move on to discussing the Listen, Then Speak question type. This is another crucial component of the Duolingo English Test that you’ll need to prepare for.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p12: The format for this question is an Oral Response to the Heard Question. This means you’ll be listening to a prompt or question and then responding verbally. It’s important to note that this type of question appears twice per session, so you’ll have multiple opportunities to showcase your listening comprehension and speaking skills.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p13: Now, let’s go through some essential tips for succeeding in this part of the test:
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p14: 1. Answer clearly and naturally: Just like in the previous question type, it’s vital to speak in a clear, confident manner. Aim for a natural conversational tone rather than sounding rehearsed.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p15: 2. Use a variety of vocabulary and sentence structures: This is your chance to demonstrate the breadth of your English language skills. Don’t shy away from using more advanced vocabulary or complex sentence structures if they fit the context of your response.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p16: 3. Ensure fluency: Strive for smooth, continuous speech. Practice speaking on various topics to improve your ability to articulate your thoughts without frequent pauses or hesitations.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p17: 4. Pay attention to pronunciation and intonation: Clear pronunciation is crucial for being understood, while proper intonation can help convey your message more effectively and naturally.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p18: 5. Make sure you understand the question and ensure your response is relevant: This tip is specific to the Listen, Then Speak format. It’s critical that you listen carefully to the question or prompt and respond appropriately. Your answer should directly address what you’ve heard.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p19: Remember, this question type is testing not only your speaking abilities but also your listening comprehension. It’s a more complex task as you need to process auditory information and then formulate a relevant spoken response.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p20: Practicing active listening skills alongside your speaking practice will be key to excelling in this part of the test. Try to expose yourself to various English accents and speaking speeds to prepare for different possibilities in the actual test.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p21: Now that we’ve gone over the question types, let’s dive into the scoring criteria. The two speaking tasks we just discussed fall under the open-response question types. For the Duolingo English Test, speaking is evaluated across six dimensions, which we’ve highlighted with red boxes. Next, we’ll go through each of these dimensions one by one.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p22: First, let’s look at content. This dimension evaluates the relevance, style, development, and effect on the reader of your response. It’s crucial to ensure that your answer directly addresses the prompt and is well-developed with appropriate style.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p23: The second dimension is discourse coherence, which applies to writing questions only. However, it’s worth noting that clarity, cohesion, progression of ideas, and structure are important in spoken responses as well, even if they’re not formally evaluated in the same way.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p24: Third, we have lexis, or vocabulary. For speaking tasks, the grading engine will assess your lexical diversity, sophistication, and choice of words. While spelling isn’t applicable to speaking, using a rich and appropriate vocabulary is key.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p25: Fourth is grammar. In speaking tasks, the system will evaluate your grammatical complexity and accuracy. Although punctuation isn’t relevant for speaking, using correct grammar in your oral responses is crucial.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p26: The fifth dimension, which is specific to speaking questions, is fluency. This includes your speed of delivery, natural use of pauses, and how much you rely on filler words, repetition, or false starts and stops. The goal is to speak smoothly and naturally.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p27: Lastly, we have pronunciation, another speaking-specific criterion. This covers intelligibility, individual sounds, word stress, sentence stress, and intonation. Clear pronunciation is essential for effective communication.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p28: Remember, the AI grading engine is designed to understand your English proficiency just like expert human raters would. It’s looking at these various aspects to form a comprehensive assessment of your speaking skills. By focusing on improving in each of these areas, you can boost your performance on the speaking sections of the Duolingo English Test.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p29: Having covered the scoring criteria, let’s take a look at the question categories for the ‘Read, Then Speak’ and ‘Listen, Then Speak’ speaking tasks.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.img2: A screenshot of DET Speaking Question Categories.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p30: As we can see, there are 3 main categories of questions you might encounter:
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p31: 1. Descriptive Questions: These questions typically ask you to describe something in detail. This could be a person, place, object, or even a process. When answering these questions, your goal is to provide a clear, vivid picture using your words. You’ll want to use specific details and sensory language to make your description come alive.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p32: 2. Argumentative/Opinion/Discussion Questions: This category is quite broad and includes questions that ask for your personal views or require you to make an argument. You might be asked to discuss a controversial topic, defend a position, or explain why you agree or disagree with a statement. The key here is to clearly state your opinion and support it with logical reasoning and relevant examples.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p33: 3. Comparative Questions: These questions will ask you to compare and contrast two or more things. This could be anything from comparing two cities to contrasting different educational systems. When answering these questions, it’s important to highlight both similarities and differences, and organize your response in a clear, logical manner.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p34: For both the ‘Read, Then Speak’ and ‘Listen, Then Speak’ tasks, you could encounter questions from any of these categories. The main difference is in how the question is presented to you – either in written form that you read, or spoken form that you listen to.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p35: Remember, regardless of the category, your response should always be relevant to the question asked. Pay attention to the specific wording of the prompt and make sure you’re addressing all parts of the question.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p36: Next, we’ll go through each of these question categories one by one, starting with Descriptive Questions. Let’s first take a look at some sample question examples:
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.ol2: Describe a famous work of art.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p38: •What does it mean to you?What do you know about the artist
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p39: 2. Describe a factory or office you have visited.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p40: •What type of work did they do there?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p43: 3. Explain the process for getting a driver’s license for the first time.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p44: •Where do you go to apply for a license?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p49: •How do you react when someone does this?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p50: •Do you think this annoys others as well?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p51: These questions require you to use descriptive language, provide specific details, and organize your thoughts clearly. They test your ability to recall and articulate visual and experiential information.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p52: Now, we’ll take a sample question and discuss a very important feature of these types of questions, which is closely related to the approach we’ll be using. The question is: Talk about something that annoys you. Why does it annoy you? How do you react when someone does this? Do you think this annoys others as well?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.img3: A diagram shows the structure of DET speaking questions.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p53: As we can see, this question can be divided into two parts. The first part is the speaking prompt or the topic, and the second part consists of specific questions. This is a very common structure in this type of question, where you have a topic followed by a series of questions.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p54: Based on the characteristics of this type of question, we can design a versatile opening sentence to help us start our response. The sentence is:
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p56: Well, for this topic, I would like to + content of the topic (modify pronouns)
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p57: Remember to modify pronouns when answering. For the sample question we mentioned earlier, we could structure the response like this: Well, for this topic, I would like to talk about something that annoys me. Notice how we changed ‘annoys you’ to ‘annoys me’ from the original prompt, making sure to adjust the pronouns accordingly. This approach allows us to create a smoother opening sentence. A strong start can reduce the pressure during the exam. If speaking is a weaker area for you, we recommend using this strategy to structure your responses.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p58: Next, let’s learn a Descriptive Answer Template. Pay attention to how this template includes the versatile opening sentence we just discussed. As with all our previous videos, we use two different colors to highlight the template sentences: blue for the fixed parts and red for the sections you can freely replace with relevant content depending on the question.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p60: Well, for this topic, I would like to + the content of the topic (modify pronouns).
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p61: One experience that stands out in my memory is when [briefly describe the event/situation]. This happened [mention when it occurred]. I was at [mention the location] when [describe the details of the event]. The reason why this experience is significant to me is [mention the importance or major impact of the event]. Looking back, I feel [mention your feelings/thoughts]. Overall, this experience [summarize what you learned or how it impacted you].
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p62: You can take a screenshot to save these template sentences.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p63: Alright, let’s try using the template sentences we just covered to answer this question. Here is the sample answer:
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p64: Well, for this topic, I would like to talk about something that annoys me.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p65: One experience that stands out in my memory is when I was constantly interrupted during a presentation. This happened a few months ago during a meeting at my workplace. I was presenting a crucial project update when a colleague repeatedly cut me off to make unnecessary comments. The reason why this experience is significant to me is because it made me realize how much I value respect and active listening in a professional setting. Being interrupted not only disrupts the flow of thoughts but also conveys a lack of respect for the speaker. Looking back, I feel frustrated yet motivated to address such situations more assertively. I reacted by politely asking my colleague to hold his questions and comments until the end of the presentation. I believe this kind of behavior can annoy others as well, as everyone deserves to be heard without interruption. Overall, this experience taught me the importance of setting boundaries and promoting a respectful communication culture.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p66: First, we can start by saying: *One experience that stands out in my memory is when I was constantly interrupted during a presentation.* This provides a brief description of the event or situation. Next, we can say: *This happened a few months ago during a meeting at my workplace.* This helps to mention when and where the event occurred. Then, we continue with: *I was presenting a crucial project update when a colleague repeatedly cut me off to make unnecessary comments.* This allows us to mention the details of the event.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p67: Following this, we can say: *The reason why this experience is significant to me is because it made me realize how much I value respect and active listening in a professional setting. Being interrupted not only disrupts the flow of thoughts but also conveys a lack of respect for the speaker.* This part addresses why the event is significant or had a major impact.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p68: Afterward, we can say: *Looking back, I feel frustrated yet motivated to address such situations more assertively. I reacted by politely asking my colleague to hold his questions and comments until the end of the presentation. I believe this kind of behavior can annoy others as well, as everyone deserves to be heard without interruption.* This helps to express your feelings or thoughts.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p69: Finally, we can conclude with: *Overall, this experience taught me the importance of setting boundaries and promoting a respectful communication culture.* This serves as a post-event summary or review. With this approach, we have a complete and coherent response.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p70: Similarly, we offer an advanced template with upgraded vocabulary for you to use. Keep in mind that for speaking tasks, the complexity of vocabulary is not a mandatory requirement for achieving a high score. For example, compared to fluency and content relevance, vocabulary complexity has a weaker impact on your score. We recommend this template for test-takers with a solid foundation in English who want to enhance their responses with more complex vocabulary. In other words, if your score requirement isn’t very high, you can stick to using the standard template for answering. Feel free to take a screenshot to save this template for future use.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p72: Well, for this topic, I would like to + the content of the topic (modify pronouns).
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p73: An episode that is indelibly etched in my memory is when [describe the event or situation]. This transpired [mention when it occurred]. I was situated at [mention where it occurred] when [detail what happened]. The reason why this experience holds paramount significance for me is [explain why the event is important or what impact it had on you]. Reflecting upon it, I feel [share your feelings or thoughts about this experience]. In retrospect, this experience [summarize or describe the impact the event had on you].
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p74: Next, we provide a sample answer using this advanced template to respond to the previous question. This answer conveys the same meaning as the earlier sample answer but uses different expressions.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p75: Well, for this topic, I would like to talk about something that annoys me.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p76: An episode that is indelibly etched in my memory is when I was constantly interrupted during a presentation. This transpired a few months ago during a meeting at my workplace. I was situated at my workplace when I was presenting a crucial project update and a colleague repeatedly cut me off to make unnecessary comments. The reason why this experience holds paramount significance for me is because it made me realize how much I value respect and active listening in a professional setting. Being interrupted not only disrupts the flow of thoughts but also conveys a lack of respect for the speaker. Reflecting upon it, I feel frustrated yet motivated to address such situations more assertively. I reacted by politely asking my colleague to hold his questions and comments until the end of the presentation. I believe this kind of behavior can annoy others as well, as everyone deserves to be heard without interruption. In retrospect, this experience taught me the importance of setting boundaries and promoting a respectful communication culture.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p77: Comparatively, this answer employs a more advanced vocabulary. You can take a screenshot and save this sample answer for future reference.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p78: Now let’s take a look at a Listen, Then Speak question. First, you may play the audio three times.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.figcaption3: DET Listen then Speak Demo Question 1
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p79: You can listen to the content of the question to determine what is being asked. After that, you may check the text-based version below. Alright, welcome back! Let’s take a look at what the questions are：
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p80: You’ll notice that the Listen, Then Speak question and the Read, Then Speak question are essentially the same in terms of structure. Both consist of one topic followed by a series of related questions. Therefore, our Versatile Opening Sentence is still applicable.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p81: For example, for this question, we could say: *Well, for this topic, I would like to describe my dream job as a teacher.*Do you remember the template sentences we discussed earlier? Let’s continue using them to answer this question.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p82: Well, for this topic, I would like to describe my dream job as a teacher. Being a teacher involves planning lessons, preparing teaching materials, instructing students, evaluating progress, providing feedback, and fostering a love of learning. It requires patience, creativity, and strong communication skills. One experience that stands out in my memory is when my father, who is a teacher, shared with me his journey of growth from a novice teacher to a successful one. This happened during a conversation we had about career paths. I was at home when he told me about the challenges he faced and how he overcame them through hard work and determination. The reason why this experience is significant to me is because it showed me the value of perseverance and dedication in achieving one’s goals. Looking back, I feel inspired by my father’s journey and motivated to pursue my own dream job as a teacher. I believe that being a teacher would allow me to make a positive impact on the world through education and help shape the minds of future generations. To qualify for this job, I would need to have relevant education and experience in teaching. The hardest thing about the job would be facing and overcoming challenges, but like my father, I am confident that with determination and hard work, I can succeed. Overall, this experience taught me the importance of following my passion and striving towards my goals.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p83: Also, a quick reminder: in our answer, we’ve used two different colors, with the blue parts representing the template sentences. You can save this answer for future reference or study.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p84: Similarly, we provide a sample answer using the advanced template we previously learned, you may save it if needed.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p85: Well, for this topic, I would like to describe my dream job as a teacher. Being a teacher involves planning lessons, preparing teaching materials, instructing students, evaluating progress, providing feedback, and fostering a love of learning. It requires patience, creativity, and strong communication skills. An episode that is indelibly etched in my memory is when my father, who is a teacher, shared with me his journey of growth from a novice teacher to a successful one. This transpired during a conversation we had about career paths. I was situated at home when he told me about the challenges he faced and how he overcame them through hard work and determination. The reason why this experience holds paramount significance for me is because it showed me the value of perseverance and dedication in achieving one’s goals. Reflecting upon it, I feel inspired by my father’s journey and motivated to pursue my own dream job as a teacher. In retrospect, this experience taught me the importance of following my passion and striving towards my goals. I believe that being a teacher would allow me to make a positive impact on the world through education and help shape the minds of future generations. To qualify for this job, I would need to have relevant education and experience in teaching. The hardest thing about the job would be facing and overcoming challenges, but like my father, I am confident that with determination and hard work, I can succeed.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p86: In the second part of this post, we’ll cover Argumentative/Opinion/Discussion Questions. First, let’s take a look at some sample questions.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.ol3: 1. Discuss whether vaccinations should be required for children.
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p87: • What are the benefits of vaccinations?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p88: • What are the risks if children are not vaccinated?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p89: • Why might people not vaccinate their children?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p91: • Do you believe certain numbers are lucky or unlucky?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p92: • Do you have any objects that you carry for good luck?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p93: • Are there any traditions in your country related to luck?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p97: • Would you like to go to space?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p99: • Do you believe they bring people together?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p100: • What are the negative consequences of these competitions?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p101: • How will sports competitions change in the future?
det-course-read-listen-then-speak.p102: We can find that all these questions fall under the Argumentative/Opinion/Discussion category, requiring you to express personal views, provide reasons for your opinions, and often consider multiple perspectives on an issue. When answering these types of questions, it’s important to clearly state your opinion, provide logical reasons or examples to support your view, consider counterarguments or alternative perspectives, use appropriate transition words to connect your ideas, and conclude with a summary of your main points.
